clinical_study.brief_title: Sarcopenia Measured by Ultrasound in Hospitalized Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: "SARCOPENIA MEASURED BY ULTRASOUND IN HOSPITALIZED OLDER ADULTS" (ECOSARC Study).

collaborator.agency: Hospital Virgen del Valle de Toledo

brief_summary.textblock: Observational prospective study in older adults admitted to an Acute Geriatric Unit, in which sarcopenia will be evaluated by ultrasound in the anterior rectus femoris muscle.

primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of sarcopenia on admission. A prevalent case of sarcopenia will be considered if a patient fulfills the EWGSOP2 at admission

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of sarcopenia between admission and discharge
primary_outcome.description: An incident case of sarcopenia will be considered if a patient not fulfilling EWGSOP2 diagnostic criteria on admission, will meet diagnostic criteria at discharge of sarcopenia at discharge (diagnosis will be considered as a dichotomous variable -yes/no-).

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle mass (the anterior rectus femoris muscle)
primary_outcome.description: The evolution of muscle mass between admission and discharge will be assessed by ultrasound

secondary_outcome.description: The mini-nutritional assessment - short form is a simple, non - invasive and validated scale for the detection of malnutrition in older adults. It takes into account the patient's loss of appetite, weight loss, motor skills, recent health status, neuropsychological disorders. The maximum score of the MNA-SF is 14: Greater than or equal to 11: normal nutritional status. Between 8 and 11: risk of malnutrition. Less than 8: malnutrition.
The evolution of the value of the 4-meter walking speed test between admission and discharge will be assessed.
the ADL questionnaire will also be performed on admission, at discharge, and at 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: SPPB score (SHORT PHYSICAL PERFORMANCE BATTERY score)
secondary_outcome.description: Short Physical Performance Battery (SPPB): score range 0-12, higher score means a better outcome
Mortality will be measured with vital status at 3 months.
Day of admission to day of discharge
Readmission(s) after index hospitalization, Dichotomous outcome (yes/no)
ED visit(s) after index hospitalization, Dichotomous outcome (yes/no)

intervention.description: All participants will undergo a muscle ultrasound on admission and at discharge

study_pop.textblock: Patients over 69 years of age admitted to Acute Geriatric Units.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 69 years of age.
- Hospitalization for a medical cause in Acute Geriatric Units.
- Holden's Functional Ambulation Classification Scale at level 1 or higher.
- Informed consent signed by the patient or legal representative.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Terminal condition or life expectancy of less than 6 months.
- Impossibility or refusal to undergo muscle ultrasound.
- Refusal for follow-up
- Severe dementia stage Global Deteriorating Scale: 7
- Impossibility in the opinion of the investigators to complete the necessary data for the study.
